title: Fuglede−Kadison determinant
summary: In mathematics, the Fuglede−Kadison determinant of an invertible operator in a finite factor is a positive real number associated with it. It defines a multiplicative homomorphism from the set of invertible operators to the set of positive real numbers. The Fuglede−Kadison determinant of an operator A {\displaystyle A} is often denoted by Δ ( A ) {\displaystyle \Delta (A)} .
